snippet: British officials are raising taxes on foreign buyers of high-end properties, possibly burnishing New York’s reputation as a safe harbor for expatriate millionaires.
abstract: Big Deal column; British officials are raising taxes on the purchase of high-end properties in England by foreign buyers; shift could make New York City property even more desirable as a safe harbor for expatriate millionaires.
lead_paragraph: British officials are raising taxes on foreign buyers of high-end properties, possibly burnishing New York’s reputation as a safe harbor for expatriate millionaires.

headline.print_headline: In London, Taxes Rise. Will Buyers Flee to New York?
headline.seo: Big Deal – In London, Real Estate Taxes Rise, But Will Buyers Flee to U.S.?
headline.main: In London, Taxes Rise. Will Buyers Flee to New York?
